info.official_title: A Phase II/III Randomized Trial of Comparison of Survival Benefit of Administration of PD1/PDL1/CTLA4 Inhibitors or Their Combinations Via Neck Artery or Intratumor Versus Vein Infusion for Immunotherapy of HNC
info.inclusion_criteria:
1. Cytohistological confirmation is required for diagnosis of HNC.
2. Signed informed consent before recruiting.
3. Age between 18 to 80 years with estimated survival over 3 months.
4. ECOG score < 2
5. Tolerable coagulation function or reversible coagulation disorders
6. Laboratory examination test within 7 days prior to procedure: WBC≥3.0×10E9/L; Hb≥90g/L； PLT ≥50×10E9/L；INR < 2.3 or PT < 6 seconds above control；Cr ≤ 145.5 umul/L；Albumin > 28 g/L；Total bilirubin < 51 μmol/L
7. At least one tumor lesion meeting measurable disease criteria as determined by RECIST v1.1.
8. Patients with advanced HNC which would not be suitable for treatment with loco-regional therapies or have progressed following locoregional therapy such as surgical resection and other treatment.
9. Birth control.
10. Willing and able to comply with scheduled visits, treatment plan and laboratory tests.
Healthy volunteers allowed
Must have minimum age of 18 Years
Must have maximum age of 80 Years

identified_line.line: Healthy volunteers allowed
Must have minimum age of 18 Years
Must have maximum age of 80 Years
1. Patients participated in other clinical trials of equipment or drugs (signed informed consent) within 4 weeks;

criterions.exact_snippets: Patients participated in other clinical trials of equipment or drugs (signed informed consent) within 4 weeks

and_criteria.exact_snippets: Patients participated in other clinical trials of equipment or drugs (signed informed consent) within 4 weeks

identified_line.line: 2. Any serious accompanying disease, which is expected to have an unknown, impact on the prognosis, include heart disease, inadequately controlled diabetes and psychiatric disorders;
3. Patients accompanied with other tumors or past medical history of malignancy;
4. Pregnant or lactating patients, all patients participating in this trial must adopt appropriate birth control measures during treatment;

criterions.exact_snippets: all patients participating in this trial must adopt appropriate birth control measures during treatment

not_criteria.exact_snippets: all patients participating in this trial must adopt appropriate birth control measures during treatment

identified_line.line: 5. Patients have poor compliance.
Any contraindications for neck artery infusion procedure:

criterions.exact_snippets: contraindications for neck artery infusion procedure

not_criteria.exact_snippets: contraindications for neck artery infusion procedure

identified_line.line: A. Impaired clotting test (platelet count < 60000/mm3, prothrombin activity < 50%).
B. Renal failure / insufficiency requiring hemo-or peritoneal dialysis. C. Known severe atheromatosis. D. Known uncontrolled blood hypertension (> 160/100 mm/Hg).

criterions.exact_snippets: Renal failure / insufficiency requiring hemo-or peritoneal dialysis.

or_criteria.exact_snippets: Renal failure / insufficiency requiring hemo-or peritoneal dialysis.

identified_line.line: 6. Allergic to adriamycin chemotherapy drugs，contrast agent or lipiodol;
7. Any agents which could affect the absorption or pharmacokinetics of the study drugs

criterions.exact_snippets: agents which could affect the absorption or pharmacokinetics of the study drugs

not_criteria.exact_snippets: agents which could affect the absorption or pharmacokinetics of the study drugs

identified_line.line: 8. Subjects unable to suffer the discomfort of the artery infusion procedure
